DOC.brief_summary: The study will investigate the ability of a new PET tracer, 18F-AV-1451, to detect depositions of a protein, called tau, in the brains of people with a mutation in the tau gene that causes deposition of the protein, and in people without the mutation. A single 18F-AV-1451 scan will be performed on control subjects without MAPT mutations, presymptomatic mutation carriers, and symptomatic mutation carriers.
DOC.brief_title: Tau PET Imaging With 18F-AV-1451 in Subjects With MAPT Mutations
DOC.criteria: Members of families with established MAPT mutations, who either have the capacity to consent to participate in the protocol, or else have designated a surrogate/proxy to consent to participate in this study Unwillingness to participate Usage of medication which significantly prolongs QT interval Pregnancy or plans for pregnancy within 90 days after participating in study
